Question: Only the queens are able to lay eggs. What was the cause of this?
Choices: (A) Many bees are infertile. (B) Other bees have no reproductive organs.

Male bees, also known as drones, have reproductive organs but they do not have the ability to lay eggs. Female worker bees have underdeveloped reproductive organs and are not able to lay fertilized eggs. Only the queen bee has fully developed reproductive organs and is able to lay eggs. Therefore, the cause of only queens being able to lay eggs is due to the fact that other bees, except for the queen, have no or underdeveloped reproductive organs.
